Description: WISCONSIN DEPREDATION PREVENTION ACTIVITIES -PREDATOR PROOF FENCE PROJECTS
WISCONSIN WOLF-LIVESTOCK DEMONSTRATION PROJECT GRANT REQUEST - DEPREDATION COMPENSATION

WITH A LONE GRAY WOLF ENTERING OREGON IN 1999, FROM IDAHOS EXPERIMENTAL POPULATION, GRAYWOLVES HAVE CONTINUED TO DISPERSE INTO OREGON AND HAVE ESTABLISHED BREEDING POPULATIONS. ASIN OTHER WESTERN STATES WITH WOLF POPULATIONS, LIVESTOCK PRODUCERS ARE AFFECTED FINANCIALLY DUETO LIVESTOCK LOSS FROM WOLF DEPREDATIONS.THE OREGON DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE (ODA) IMPLEMENTS THE WOLF DEPREDATION COMPENSATIONAND FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE COUNTY BLOCK GRANT PROGRAM. FUNDS FROM THIS GRANT PROGRAM AREAWARDED TO COUNTY WOLF ADVISORY COMMITTEES PROGRAMS UNDER WHICH: COMPENSATION MAY BE AWARDED TO PERSONS WHO SUFFER LOSS OR INJURY TO LIVESTOCK ORWORKING DOGS DUE TO WOLF DEPREDATION  COMPENSATION MAY BE AWARDED TO REIMBURSE PERSONS FOR LIVESTOCK OR WORKING DOGS THATARE DETERMINED TO BE MISSING DUE TO WOLF DEPREDATION  FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE IS PROVIDED TO PERSONS WHO IMPLEMENT LIVESTOCK MANAGEMENTTECHNIQUES OR NONLETHAL WOLF DETERRENCE TECHNIQUES DESIGNED TO DISCOURAGE WOLFDEPREDATION OF LIVESTOCK  COMPENSATION MAY BE AWARDED TO COUNTIES FOR ALLOWABLE EXPENSES ASSOCIATED WITH THEIMPLEMENTATION OF THE COUNTY WOLF ADVISORY COMMITTEE AND GRANT PROGRAM WITHIN THEIRRESPECTIVE COUNTY.IN SUMMARY, THE FOLLOWING FACTORS SUPPORT AND JUSTIFY THE NEED FOR CONTINUED WORK AND FUNDINGOF ODAS COUNTY WOLF GRANT PROGRAM: A STEADY INCREASE IN THE WOLF POPULATION, REPRODUCTIVE RATES AND GEOGRAPHICALDISTRIBUTION OF WOLVES IN OREGON  UPWARD TRENDS IN THE NUMBER OF REPORTED POTENTIAL WOLF DEPREDATION CASES TO ODFW  UPWARD TRENDS IN THE NUMBER OF TOTAL INVESTIGATIONS CONDUCTED BY ODFW  INCREASE IN THE NUMBER OF CONFIRMED CASES, NUMBER OF AFFECTED ANIMALS ANDREIMBURSEMENT COSTS FOR DEAD ANIMALS AND TREATMENT COSTS FOR INJURED ANIMALS  INCREASED EDUCATION AND TRAINING EFFORTS BY COUNTY, STATE AND FEDERAL PARTNERS  INCREASE NUMBER OF LAND OWNERS PARTICIPATING IN THE PROGRAM  INCREASES IN COLLABORATION AND INFORMATION SHARING BETWEEN COUNTY PROGRAMS, ODA,ODFW, USFWS AND USDA REGARDING WOLF - RELATED POSITIONS, PROJECTS, DATA AND FUNDSHARING.CONTINUED FEDERAL FUNDING OF ODAS WOLF GRANT PROGRAM ALLOWS ODA TO LEVERAGE STATE GENERALFUND INVESTMENTS AND CONTINUE ITS ONGOING WORK IN THE AREA OF DEVELOPING TRUST ANDPARTNERSHIPS WITH LOCAL COMMUNITIES AND MAINTAINING A COOPERATIVE STATE-WIDE LIVESTOCKPRODUCER ASSISTANCE PROGRAM THAT PROACTIVELY MINIMIZES WOLF-LIVESTOCK CONFLICT AND ASSISTSLIVESTOCK PRODUCERS EXPERIENCING WOLF-RELATED LIVESTOCK LOSSES. THE NUMBER OF REPORTED WOLVES,REPORTS OF POSSIBLE WOLF DEPREDATION, ODFW INVESTIGATION, CONFIRMED WOLF DEPREDATION CASESAND NUMBER OF EFFECTED ANIMALS ALL ARE TRENDING UPWARDS.

THE DEPARTMENT ADMINISTERS A PROGRAM TO COMPENSATE LIVESTOCK OWNERS FOR DAMAGE CAUSED BY WOLVES DESIGNATED TROPHY GAME ANIMALS PER WYOMING STATE STATUTE. THE PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THE DAMAGE COMPENSATION PROGRAM IS TOREIMBURSE PRIVATE PARTIES FOR COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH LIVESTOCK DAMAGE BY PUBLICLY-OWNED WILDLIFE, INCLUDINGWOLVES. THE SECONDARY PURPOSE OF THE DAMAGE COMPENSATION PROGRAM IS TO INCREASE PUBLIC TOLERANCE IN A COHORT OFTHE PUBLIC DIRECTLY IMPACTED BY WOLF PRESENCE ON THE LANDSCAPE (I.E., LIVESTOCK PRODUCERS).IN PREPARATION FOR WOLF DELISTING IN 2008, THE WYOMING LEGISLATURE ADOPTED STATUTES THAT DIRECTED THE DEPARTMENTTO DEVELOP A COMPENSATION PROGRAM FOR CONFIRMED LIVESTOCK KILLED OR INJURED BY WOLVES SIMILAR TO STATUTES ALREADYIN PLACE FOR OTHER TROPHY GAME ANIMALS (E.G., MOUNTAIN LIONS, BLACK BEARS, AND GRIZZLY BEARS). THE WYOMING GAMEAND FISH COMMISSION REVISED ITS LIVESTOCK DAMAGE COMPENSATION REGULATION TO INCLUDE WOLVES TO COMPLY WITH THESTATUTE IN 2008, AND THE DEPARTMENT HAS BEEN INVESTIGATING AND PROVIDING COMPENSATION FOR CONFIRMED LIVESTOCKLOSS CAUSED BY WOLVES IN THE WTGMAS SINCE THAT TIME. COMPENSATION IS NOT AVAILABLE FOR LIVESTOCK LOSS FROMWOLVES WHERE THEY ARE DESIGNATED AS PREDATORY ANIMALS YEAR-ROUND. ALL ELEMENTS OF WYOMINGS WOLF-LIVESTOCKDEPREDATION INVESTIGATION AND COMPENSATION PROGRAM ARE OUTLINED IN STATUTE, REGULATION AND POLICY, WHICH LENDSITSELF TO A ROBUST AND RIGOROUS PROCESS FOR EVALUATING DEPREDATION AND PROVIDING COMPENSATION.

FUNDING SUPPORTS COLORADO S EFFORTS RESPONDING TO THE NEWLY ESTABLISHED WOLF POPULATION AND THE POPULATION THAT WILL BE INTRODUCED UNDER PROPOSITION 114. GRANT FUNDS ARE TO SUPPORT COMPENSATION EFFORTS FOR DEPREDATION AND TO PROVIDE PREVENTION RESOURCES TO DISCOURAGE LIVESTOCK LOSSES.

WDFW HAS AN APPROVED GRAY WOLF RECOVERY PLAN AND THE DEPARTMENT MANAGES WOLVES AND WOLF-LIVESTOCK CONFLICTS WITH A PRIMARY EMPHASIS ON NON-LETHAL DETERRENCE TOOLS AND TECHNIQUES TO REDUCE RISK OF CONFLICTS. PREVENTING WOLFCONFLICTS NOT ONLY SAVES WOLVES, IT REDUCES FINANCIAL IMPACTS AND STRESS FOR LIVESTOCK PRODUCERS, AND FOSTERSSUPPORT FOR WOLF RECOVERY EFFORTS. WDFW HAS GONE TO GREAT LENGTHS TO INNOVATE AND DEVELOP NOT ONLY PROVEN TOOLSAND TECHNIQUES, BUT IS CONSTANTLY SEEKING NEW TOOLS AND TECHNIQUES TO INCREASE EFFECTIVENESS OF CONFLICTPREVENTION. WE HAVE ATTACHED A DETAILED NARRATIVE DOCUMENT TO SUPPORT THIS APPLICATION FOR FUNDING THAT OUTLINESWASHINGTON S WOLF POPULATION RECOVERY EFFORTS AND PROGRESS AND INCLUDES SPECIFIC DATA REGARDING WOLF-LIVESTOCKCONFLICTS AND RESPONSE TO INCIDENTS OF CONFLICT.WITH THIS FUNDING:1. WDFW WILL CONTINUE TO IMPLEMENT EXISTING CONFLICT MANAGEMENT TOOLS TO WORK WITH LIVESTOCK OPERATORS TOIMPLEMENT NON-LETHAL MEASURES FOR CONFLICT PREVENTION WHILE EXPANDING UPON EXISTING TECHNIQUES AND TESTING NEWTOOLS. THESE EFFORTS WILL INCLUDE:A. CONTINUE INCREASING OPPORTUNITIES FOR LIVESTOCK OPERATORS TO USE KNOWN NON-LETHAL DETERRENT TOOLS AND DEVICES,AND TO ENGAGE IN USING PRIVATE, COST-SHARED, OR STATE CONTRACTED RANGE RIDERS AND OPPORTUNITIES FOR LIVESTOCKOPERATORS TO JOINTLY USE RANGE RIDERS ACROSS ADJACENT GRAZING ALLOTMENTS OR PASTURES TO FURTHER ENHANCE HUMANPRESENCE IN TARGET AREAS OF CONCERN THROUGH DAMAGE PREVENTION COOPERATIVE AGREEMENTS FOR LIVESTOCK (DPCA-L).B. WDFW WILL UTILIZE DEPARTMENT CONTRACTED RANGE RIDERS TO FURTHER SUPPORT INCREASED HUMAN PRESENCE.C. EXPAND AND DEVELOP ADDITIONAL OPTIONS FOR DISPOSAL OF LIVESTOCK CARCASSES, INCLUDING AGREEMENTS WITH AREASANITATION PROGRAMS AND RENDERING SERVICES.D. ACQUISITION AND USE OF ELECTRONIC SCARE DEVICES INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO SUCH DEVICES AS RAG BOXES, ANDFOX LIGHTS.E. ASSISTANCE WITH COSTS RELATED TO LIVESTOCK GUARDING DOGS.F. ACQUISITION AND INSTALLATION OF TEMPORARY FENCING, AND FLADRY.2. DEVELOP, TEST, AND DEPLOY NEW SUSTAINABLE, LOW COST, PREVENTION TECHNIQUES OR TOOLS TO MINIMIZE WOLF-LIVESTOCK

ARIZONA GAME AND FISH DEPARTMENT HAS ACTIVELY PARTNERED IN THE MEXICAN WOLF REINTRODUCTIONPROGRAM SINCE ITS INCEPTION AND ADDITIONALLY PROVIDES ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT TO THE AZ LIVESTOCKLOSS BOARD (ALLB). THE ALLB HAS DEPLOYED CONFLICT AVOIDANCE FUNDING PROGRAMS SINCE 2016WITH GRANT FUNDS UTILIZED TO COMPENSATE PARTICIPATING AZ LIVESTOCK PRODUCERS FOR CONFLICTPREVENTION MEASURES THEY DEPLOY TO REDUCE MEXICAN WOLF DEPREDATIONS OF, OR INTERACTIONS WITHLIVESTOCK. THE PROJECT BUDGET IS  83,242 WITH  83.242 REPRESENTING NON-FEDERAL MATCH AND  79,080(95 ) OF FEDERAL FUNDS SUPPORTING DIRECT PAYMENTS TO ALLB-APPROVED APPLICANTS AND  4,162 (5 ) OFFEDERAL FUNDS DIRECTED TO NATIONAL FISH AND WILDLIFE FOUNDATION FOR CONTRACTED PAYMENT PROCESSING ANDTRACKING SERVICES.

NMDA CONTINUES TO SUPPORT THE REINTRODUCTION OF ENDANGERED MEXICAN GRAY WOLVES TO NEW MEXICO.  RECOVERY OF THE MEXICAN GRAY WOLF DEPENDS ON THE COEXISTENCE OF WOLVES AND LIVESTOCK, AND THE SUPPORT OF LIVESTOCK PRODUCERS IN THE GEOGRAPHICAL AREA WITH THE HIGHEST RISKS OF WOLF LIVESTOCK INTERACTIONS.  NMDA IMPLEMENTS THE WOLF LIVESTOCK LOSS DEMONSTRATION PROGRAM WITH SEVERAL GOVERNMENT AND NON GOVERNMENT PARTNERS, AND ENCOURAGES THE HIGHEST LEVELS OF LIVESTOCK PRODUCER PARTICIPATION IN THE PREVENTION OF WOLF LIVESTOCK INTERACTIONS.  WHEN SUCH INTERACTIONS ARE UNAVOIDABLE, NMDA ENSURES LIVESTOCK PRODUCERS ARE COMPENSATED FOR CERTIFIED WOLF DEPREDATIONS OF LIVESTOCK IN A TIMELY MANNER.  TO ACCOMPLISH THESE GOALS, NMDA AND PARTNERS WILL CONTINUE PARTICIPATION IN THE MEXICAN WOLF  LIVESTOCK COEXISTENCE COUNCIL (COUNCIL), AND NMDA WILL FACILITATE THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A NEW MEXICO COUNTY LIVESTOCK LOSS AUTHORITY (CLLA).  THE PURPOSE OF THE CLLA IS FOR LOCAL COUNTY OFFICIALS TO ENGAGE, AND INTERACT WITH THE LIVESTOCK PRODUCERS IN NEW MEXICO COUNTIES ENCOMPASSED BY ZONE 1 OF THE MEXICAN WOLF EXPERIMENTAL POPULATION AREA (MWEPA).  NMDA ANTICIPATES THAT THE ESTABLISHMENT OF THE CLLA WILL RESULT IN GREATER EFFICIENCIES IN PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION, HIGHER TRUST IN THE PROGRAM AMONG LIVESTOCK PRODUCERS IN HIGH RISK WOLF LIVESTOCK INTERACTION AREAS, AND GREATER PARTICIPATION IN THE PROGRAM.  NMDAS PARTNERS WILL CONTINUE TO ASSIST NEW MEXICO LIVESTOCK PRODUCERS WITH THE IMPLEMENTATION OF PREVENTIVE MEASURES, MONITORING, AND ADAPTIVE MANAGEMENT TO ENSURE THE HIGHEST RATE OF SUCCESS.  NMDA WILL MAINTAIN PROGRAM OVERSIGHT  ENSURING REPORTS, INSPECTIONS, EXPENDITURES, AND PROGRESS ARE REPORTED TO THE USFWS.

ARIZONA GAME AND FISH DEPARTMENT HAS ACTIVELY PARTNERED IN THE MEXICAN WOLF REINTRODUCTION PROGRAMSINCE ITS INCEPTION AND ADDITIONALLY PROVIDES ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT TO THE AZ LIVESTOCK LOSS BOARD (ALLB).THE ALLB HAS DEPLOYED DEPREDATION COMPENSATION PROGRAMS SINCE 2016 WITH GRANT FUNDS UTILIZED TOCOMPENSATE PARTICIPATING AZ LIVESTOCK PRODUCERS FOR INDEPENDENTLY CONFIRMED MEXICAN WOLF DEPREDATIONSOF LIVESTOCK AT EXISTING MARKET RATES. THE PROJECT BUDGET IS  231,000 WITH  115,500 REPRESENTING NON FEDERALMATCH AND  109,725 (95 ) OF FEDERAL FUNDS SUPPORTING DIRECT PAYMENTS TO ALLB APPROVED APPLICANTS AND 5,775 (5 ) OF FEDERAL FUNDS DIRECTED TO NATIONAL FISH AND WILDLIFE FOUNDATION FOR CONTRACTED PAYMENTPROCESSING AND TRACKING SERVICES.

PURPOSE THE ACTIVITIES THIS APPLICATION IF FUNDED WILL COMPENSATE LIVESTOCK PRODUCERS IN IDAHO FOR CONFIRMED LIVESTOCK LOSSES (KILLS OR INJURIES) THAT ARE VERIFIED BY USDA WILDLIFE SERVICES OR OTHER AUTHORIZED AGENTS. THE APPLICATION WILL ALSO FUND ACTIVITIES TO HELP PRODUCERS WITH ACQUIRING AND IMPLEMENTING MEASURES THAT CAN HELP REDUCE CONFLICT BETWEEN WOLVES AND LIVESTOCK BEFORE IT OCCURS.DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES FOR THE COMPENSATION PROGRAM LIVESTOCK PRODUCERS WILL BE COMPENSATED FOR LOSSES BASED ON THE AVERAGE MARKET RATE FOR WHAT THEY WOULD HAVE SOLD THAT ANIMAL FOR DURING THAT GRAZING SEASON. THE EXPECTED OUTCOME WILL BE TO MAINTAIN A TOLERANCE FOR WOLVES AMONG PRODUCERS AND THE COMMUNITY BY COMPENSATING SOME OF THE LOSSES.FOR THE PREVENTION PROGRAM PRODUCERS WILL BE PROVIDED FINANCIAL INCENTIVES FOR LIVESTOCK PRODUCERS AND ORGANIZATION HELPING PRODUCERS TO IMPLEMENT MEASURES TO PREVENT CONFLICT SUCH AS OFFSETTING THE COST OF RANGE RIDERS TO INCREASE HUMAN PRESENCE, PURCHASING TOOLS SUCH AS FOX LIGHTS, NOISE MAKERS, NIGHT PENS, FLADRY, GUARD DOGS, TRAIL CAMERAS, ETC. THE EXPECTED OUTCOME WILL BE TO HELP PRODUCERS REDUCE CONFLICT BETWEEN WOLVES AND LIVESTOCK, THUS REDUCING THE AMOUNT OF CONTROL ACTIONS THAT OCCUR AFTER CONFLICT.

FUNDS UNDER THIS AWARD ARE TO BE USED TO PROVIDE PAYMENT FOR WOLF PRESENCE AND FOR CONFLICT AVOIDANCE MEASURES.
. FUNDS UNDER THIS AWARD ARE TO BE USED TO PROVIDE PAYMENT FOR CONFIRMED MEXICAN WOLF DEPREDATIONS.

THE AREA TO BE COVERED UNDER THIS CONFLICT PREVENTION GRANT APPLICATION INCLUDES THE ENTIRE STATE OF ARIZONA, TO THE EXTENT THAT VERIFIED MEXICAN WOLF CONFLICTS AND OPPORTUNITIES TO IMPLEMENT PROACTIVE PREVENTATIVE MEASURES WITH LIVESTOCK OPERATIONS WILL OCCUR WITHIN THE STATE. MORE SPECIFICALLY, THE AREA TO BE COVERED CORRESPONDS TO THE MEXICAN WOLF EXPERIMENTAL POPULATION AREA (MWEPA) WITHIN THE STATE OF ARIZONA.
